revised_title: Anatomy and Function of Salivary Glands and Lymphatic Insertions
tldr: The author describes the anatomy and function of the external maxillar and other salivary glands, as well as the insertions of lymphatic vessels into veins. The external maxillar glands are found in both humans and animals and play a role in producing saliva. The author also discusses the differences between various types of salivary glands and their functions. Additionally, the article provides detailed illustrations of the lymphatic system and its connections to veins.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Anatomy and Physiology
